title: Phyllis' Wedding
description: Michael exaggerates the importance of his small role in Phyllis's wedding and makes an ass out of himself, and Pam notices that Phyllis stole all of her wedding ideas from her original wedding plans.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Damn, lost another file. Going to have to reboot. Again. [Windows reboot sound] Hey, Dwight, do you want an Altoid?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: What do you think?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: In school, we learned about this scientist who trained dogs to salivate at the sound of a bell by feeding them whenever a bell rang. For the last couple of weeks I've been conducting a similar experiment.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: [Windows reboot sound] Dwight, want an Altoid?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Okay.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: [Windows reboot sound] Altoid?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Sure

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: [Windows reboot sound] Mint Dwight?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Inbwit? Yes.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: [Windows reboot sound] [Dwight holds out his hand, sighs]

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: What are you doing?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: What?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: I don't know. My mouth tastes so bad all of a sudden. [nasty, dry mouth-smaking noise]

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Always the bridesmaids, right ladies?

quotes.speaker: Photographer
quotes.text: Okay, for this next one everyone hop out. Just Phyllis and Dad. Actually, let's bring Mom back in. And the sisters. And you, and you, and you. Great.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Phyllis is getting married. And I am in the wedding party. She has asked me to push her father's wheelchair down the aisle. So, basically, I am co-giving away the bride. Since I pay her salary it is like I'm paying for the wedding. Which I'm happy to do. It's a big day for Phyllis. But it's an even bigger day for me. Employer of the bride.

quotes.speaker: Phyllis
quotes.text: Yes, I put Michael in my wedding. It was the only way I could think to get six weeks off for my honeymoon. No one else has ever gotten six weeks before.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Phyllis... ended up using the exact same invitations as Roy and me. So it was kind of like being invited to my own wedding. And I was like 'Wait, thought I called that off'.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: So what's in the box?

quotes.speaker: Stanley
quotes.text: A toaster, you?

quotes.speaker: Karen
quotes.text: A toaster.

quotes.speaker: Stanley
quotes.text: Unbelievable.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Hello, Angela.

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: Hi, Dwight.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: You look as beautiful as the Queen of England.

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: Thank you. Don't linger. Break left. Left!

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: The Shrutes have their own traditions.   We usually marry standing in our own graves. Makes the funerals very romantic, but the weddings are a bleak affair.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Those flowers are nice.

quotes.speaker: Karen
quotes.text: Yeah. P and R?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Phyllis and Robert.

quotes.speaker: Karen
quotes.text: Ah, of course.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Also, Pam and Roy.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: There she is. I swear Phyllis you are as beautiful as the first day you started work at Dunder Mifflin.

quotes.speaker: Phyllis
quotes.text: Thanks, Michael. That's sweet. Same as when you said it outside.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: How you doin'? You excited.

quotes.speaker: Phyllis
quotes.text: Yes, very.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Me, too. If you need to vomit, that is ok. I did. Do you want to talk about tonight?

quotes.speaker: Phyllis
quotes.text: No.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: You're probably worried about pleasing Bob. A lot of pressure. Phyllis, did you break wind? It's okay, if you did. It's a very natural reaction. It's your wedding. And you're nervous...

quotes.speaker: Phyllis
quotes.text: That wasn't me.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Okay... umm... I'm sure that Bob... Wow. That is... that is pungent. I lost my train of thought. Aaah... Are you set on that hairstyle?

quotes.speaker: Phyllis
quotes.text: I thought it was...

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Here, let me...

quotes.speaker: Phyllis
quotes.text: Michael... No.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Just cover up that bald patch.

quotes.speaker: Phyllis
quotes.text: I don't need your... thank you. No, Michael please... I just need some time alone.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Okay.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: You might be surprised to learn that I've only been to one other wedding. It's actually a very cute story. My Mom was marrying Jeff. And they asked me to be ring bearer. I was understandably emotional and somehow my pants became wet.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: [in video of Michael as a kid] I hate you!

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Long story short: Jeff's dog ended up as ring bearer. And the irony is that after the ceremony that dog peed on everything and nobody said 'boo'.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Why are all these people here? There are too many people on this Earth. We need a new plague. Who are all these people?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: You know what? I bet a lot of them are wedding crashers.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: No way.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Did you ever see that movie?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Of course I saw it.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: I saw Wedding Crashers accidentally. I bought a ticket for Grizzly Man and went into the wrong theatre. After an hour, I figured I was in the wrong theatre, but I kept waiting. That's the thing about bear attacks, they come when you least expect it.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: You know I just wish, I wish, I had the investigative powers to smoke some of these guys out.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Once again, Jim, I will take care of this. I will locate the wedding crashers and report them to Phyllis. That way I won't have to get her a gift.

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: [to Toby's date] Hi. I'm Kevin. [to Toby] Where did you find her?

quotes.speaker: Toby
quotes.text: At the gym.

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: Riiight. The gym. [snickers]

quotes.speaker: Kelly
quotes.text: Could you scoot over? You're on my dress.

quotes.speaker: Meredith
quotes.text: I thought you're not supposed to wear white to a wedding.

quotes.speaker: Kelly
quotes.text: I know but there was an emergency.

quotes.speaker: Kelly
quotes.text: I look really good in white.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: This strappy young lad sitting here is Phyllis' father, Albert, and he is quite the ladies' man, aren't you Albert, hah? Ah, ringbearer. I could have done better. I will do better. I am going to be better. I can't believe I'm actually doing this! Ooh! Are you ready for this, Albert? I am. Let's do it.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: That's my dress.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: [whispers to father] That's ok. [Albert gets out of his wheelchair and starts walking]

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: It's a miracle.

quotes.speaker: Crowd
quotes.text: [generalized clapping]

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: This is bull****!

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Me walking Phyllis down the aisle was supposed to be the highlight of the wedding. And now... the wedding has no highlight.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: I can't believe I pushed that... that guy's lazy ass around all day... until he was ready to stand up and steal the show. That's... well... I got news for you, Albert. If that's your real name. The show's not over.

quotes.speaker: Priest
quotes.text: And do you, Phyllis, take Bob Vance, Vance Refrigeration, to be your lawfully wedded husband?

quotes.speaker: Phyllis
quotes.text: I do.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Ladies and Gentlemen, may I present to you for the first time as a couple, Mr. and Mrs. Bob Vance!

quotes.speaker: Priest
quotes.text: And do you, Bob...

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Oh, shiii...

quotes.speaker: Priest
quotes.text: ... take Phyllis to be your lawfully wedded wife

quotes.speaker: Bob Vance
quotes.text: I do.

quotes.speaker: Priest
quotes.text: You may now kiss the bride.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Ladies and Gentleman, for the first time as a couple, Mr. and Mrs. Bob Vance. [generalized clapping and cheering] Yeah! That's what I'm talking about!

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: Congratulations, Phyllis. You look lovely. Your dress is very white. So white, my eyes are burning.

quotes.speaker: Phyllis
quotes.text: Thanks Angela.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Congratulations, Bob. You're a good man. But just know... if you ever lay a finger on Phyllis, I will kill you.

quotes.speaker: Bob Vance
quotes.text: If you ever lay I finger on Phyllis, I'll kill you.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Agreed. No fingers will be laid on Phyllis. [to Albert] Oh, decided to sit down again, huh? Great. Bet you can hear me, too.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Best of luck, Phyllis. Also I'm going to need to see a copy of the guest manifest as well as photographs of the caterers.

quotes.speaker: Phyllis
quotes.text: I don't have that, Dwight.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Dammit, Phyllis!

quotes.speaker: Kelly
quotes.text: Are you all right? This must be so awful for you.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: What do you mean?

quotes.speaker: Kelly
quotes.text: Well... this was supposed to be your wedding.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Oh... um... no.  That's... um... That's actually fine

quotes.speaker: Kelly
quotes.text: There's no way it's fine. I'm sorry. If I was you, I would just like freak out and get really drunk and then tell someone I was pregnant.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Okay, that's a lot of good ideas. Thanks

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: 'Scuse me, sir. How do you know the happy couple?

quotes.speaker: Uncle Al
quotes.text: Who?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: The bride and groom? What are their names?

quotes.speaker: Uncle Al
quotes.text: Oh, I... I don't... I'm not sure.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Oh I get it, I get it, come on, freeloader. Let's move it. Come on. Come on.

quotes.speaker: Uncle Al
quotes.text: Okay, Okay. Where are we going?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Got to find yourself another wedding to crash, my friend.

quotes.speaker: Uncle Al
quotes.text: Oh!

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Phyllis! Are you happy with everything? What can I do to make it more perfecter?

quotes.speaker: Phyllis
quotes.text: It's beautiful. Why don't you find your seat. Enjoy the buffet.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: I'm already on it. The chicken? Totally undercooked. I sent it back.

quotes.speaker: Phyllis
quotes.text: It's fish.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: I will take care of that.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: I do. I know a fair amount about fine food... and drink. This is a white.

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: No this is not our first wedding. This is the THIRD wedding that Scrantonicity has played. We also played our bassist's wedding and our guitarist's wedding.

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: Attention, everyone. Attention, please. I am supposed to ask if anyone has seen Uncle Al. He is old and has brown eyes and dementia. His family is very concerned. It is a very serious situation. [sings] Roxanne. You don't have to put on your red light.

quotes.speaker: Roy
quotes.text: Hey.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Hey.

quotes.speaker: Roy
quotes.text: I know I normally don't notice these kind of things but uh... This wedding's really nice! I mean, the flowers and stuff? Phyllis has got some great taste.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: You're kidding me, right?

quotes.speaker: Roy
quotes.text: I know you're probably not going to remember this, right? But um... Those color roses? I got you those color roses for our prom.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Roy, I picked those flowers. Phyllis just stole all of my ideas for our wedding.

quotes.speaker: Roy
quotes.text: I uh guess I wasn't really too involved in the planning.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Yeah.

quotes.speaker: Roy
quotes.text: Sorry about that.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: It's okay.

quotes.speaker: Roy
quotes.text: You think this sucks for you? I was the one who actually wanted to get married.

quotes.speaker: Randy
quotes.text: Phyllis, you're a wonderful woman. And you're a hell of a bowler!

quotes.speaker: Crowd
quotes.text: [cheering and clapping]

quotes.speaker: Unknown
quotes.text: She is.

quotes.speaker: Randy
quotes.text: Cheers.

quotes.speaker: Crowd
quotes.text: Cheers.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Thank you, Randy. That was great. Thank you. Thank you very much. Hi, I'm Michael Scott and for the next forty minutes, I'm going to be your tour guide through the lives of Phyllis Lapin and Bob Vance.  One of the great, seemingly impossible, love stories of our time. My name is Michael Scott. Webster's Dictionary defines "wedding" as the fusing of two metals with a hot torch. Well, you know something. I think you guys are two metals. Gold medals. For those of you who don't know me, I'm Michael Scott, Phyllis' boss. To quote from The Princess Bride "Mawige...

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: The most important part of a speech is the opening line. When time is not a factor, I like to try out three or four different ones.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Phyllis and Bob: their celebrity couple name would be Phlob. You look at her... and she's kind of matronly today, but back in High School, I swear, her nickname was 'Easy Rider'. Now as for Bob... Bob Vance...

quotes.speaker: Bob Vance
quotes.text: Oh okay. That's enough.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: is a guy that...

quotes.speaker: Bob Vance
quotes.text: Thanks, Michael. Give me...

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: he works... Okay hold, hold on, hold on. Look. Look. I didn't say anything when Phyllis' dad upstaged me at the ceremony. And I think you owe me this. Kay.

quotes.speaker: Bob Vance
quotes.text: Give me the microphone.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: No. I'm not going to...

quotes.speaker: Bob Vance
quotes.text: Give me... Give me the microphone, Michael.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Ok. All right.

quotes.speaker: Bob Vance
quotes.text: You're out of here!

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Oh. Yeah. You're out of here! You're... Yeah. I hate you!

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Hey.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Hey!

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: When are we going to get to see some of those famous Beesly dance moves?

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Oh... I'm pacing myself.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Come on. Get out there. Give the people what they want.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: No. I'm such a dorky dancer.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: I know. It's very cute.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Hypothetically, if I thought Pam was interested, then... No, it's totally hypothetical.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Come... Come on!

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: I can't let you in, Michael.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Dwight, just...

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: No, it's Bob and Phyllis' orders.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Look, I just wanted to go in and quietly sit and have a piece of cake. I'm not even going to dance one song.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: You are a real life wedding crasher and I must bounce you. I'm sorry, it gives me no pleasure.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: OK.

quotes.speaker: Roy
quotes.text: Hey, they're playing our song.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Yeah, that's weird. I thought they only played the Police.

quotes.speaker: Roy
quotes.text: I know. Uh... I gave them twenty bucks. You want to dance?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: [sings] ee... I was meant for you... buppity du bom bu.

quotes.speaker: Roy
quotes.text: [to Pam] Hey, want to get out of here?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Here's a 'not hypothetical'. I'm really happy I'm with Karen.

quotes.speaker: Karen
quotes.text: [sings] Every little thing she does is magic. Every little thing she do just turns me on. Even though my life before was tragic. Now I know my love for her goes on. Every...

quotes.speaker: Women
quotes.text: One... Two... Three. Ahhhh! [Phyllis throws the flowers, Ryan knocks them out of Kelly's hands, Toby's date gets them]

quotes.speaker: Toby
quotes.text: Toby! Yeah!

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: I just want Phyllis to have a great day.

quotes.speaker: Uncle Al
quotes.text: Phyllis and you will be great together.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: We are great together. We are a great team.

quotes.speaker: Uncle Al
quotes.text: The Celtics were a great team.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Yes. Yes. They were. Robert Parrish! I should talk to her. I don't want this to ruin her honeymoon.

quotes.speaker: Uncle Al
quotes.text: Nobody ever helped me. I had to do it myself. Even the doctor didn't know!

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Dude, keep it together. I listened to you for half an hour even though most of that stuff went right over my head.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Phyllis. Phyllis! Wait! Please. I'm sorry. I just... I just wanted to make this a day to remember.

quotes.speaker: Phyllis
quotes.text: You found Uncle Al!

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Yeah. Yeah. He's kind of a weirdo.

quotes.speaker: Phyllis
quotes.text: Thank you, Michael.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: You're... You're welcome.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: They say that your wedding day goes by in such a flash that your lucky if you even get a piece of your own cake. I say that's crazy. I say let them eat cake. Margaret Thatcher said that about marriage. Smart broad.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Be careful. Oh no!! [Phyllis and Bob smear cake on each other's face] Oh wow! Phyllis! Phyllis! You look like a clown! Here. Get me! Get me! [Michael smears cake on his own face]
